alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 5:34PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Decatur and Red Willow Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 533 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of McCook, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Decatur and Red Willow Counties, including the following locations... Traer and Cedar Bluffs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong winds associated with this storm will result in areas of reduced visibility associated with blowing dust. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
